roleset.name: move rapidly
roleset.note: DART-V NOTES: Based on Brown. Member of VNcls run-51.3.2 (from dart.01-v)

roles.note: Just to be clear, if an intransitive subject is clearly something that is not moving of its own accord, you can use arg1 for it (like eyes). If it's a bird or a fox, arg0.

role.descr: agent of motion (includes volitional intransitive subjects)
entity being moved around (includes non-volitional intransitive subjects)

example.name: with arg0
example.text: He darted his eyes from one tea cup to the next.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: They were covered with tiny white blossoms, their scant roots clawing at the stony ground, and wild birds darted in and about and through them so they were nearly alive with the rustle and cry.
example.arg: in and about and through them
so they were nearly alive with the rustle and cry

example.name: dart-v
example.text: Just then Charles Lever yelled, ``Hey, Jack'', from the quarry road which ran behind the Carter house, and Jack grabbed the lunch from the table and darted out the kitchen door, yelling ``Good-bye, Mom'' over his shoulder.

example.name: thing moved is a glance.
example.text: The fox darted him a green-eyed glance

example.name: dart-v: non-volitional subject
example.text: His small black eyes darted inside the olive oval of his face.
example.arg: inside the olive oval of his face

roleset.name: shoot with a dart
roleset.note: DART-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls poison-42.2. Comparison to "knife". (from dart.02-v)

example.name: All args
example.text: The Wildlife Services agent darted the bear with tranquilizers with little effect.

roleset.name: take a tuck out of a fabric item
roleset.note: DART-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to "hem". (from dart.03-v)

example.name: Both args
example.text: My tailor then darted the shirt by removing fabric from the sides and adding two small pleats.
example.arg: by removing fabric from the sides and adding two small pleats.
